intro: Phyllanthus nummulariifolius subsp. vinanibeae, commonly known as the Vinanibeae phyllanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, round, waxy leaves that resemble coins, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to specific regions in Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
